1566570350_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw.body: The worst are the parents nurturing their children with religious belives, making critical questioning by the children impossible and making in some cases new fundamentalists (creationism).

> [xcape2net](#comment_395_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): My feeling about religion is that it's about mystery.  When mysteries are replaced with knowledge, the religion that we used to explain the mystery is replaced by knowledge.  But I expect there will always be mysteries remaining that will be fertile grounds for religion.  The more we learn, and the more enlightened we become, the more enlightened our religion becomes.  Carl Sagan defined God as the laws of nature.  I suspect that was not just a euphemism for atheism.  I suspect that he was as serious and committed to understanding his god as some fundamentalists are to understanding theirs.  If religion really is about mystery, then religion is not disappearing, it's just changing names and changing forms.

God of gaps

1568652007_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdo.body:
> [kidcourageous](#comment_242_1aaGBN84Cc8VE7iocUxPXiRVhx9qSfXw6): just get a gunthis kinda shit happens when you let your government disarm you

Having more guns in circulation means having more people who could point a gun at you. If that happens, there is no running away from a fight anymore. Also the police would have to be more armed than you (machineguns in the USA). All in all there is more killing potential. On the other hand, if someone breaks in my house, I would like to have the means to protect me (; armed robberies are not unheard of here). All in all advanced weapons are a doubleedged sword.

> [kidcourageous](#comment_248_1aaGBN84Cc8VE7iocUxPXiRVhx9qSfXw6): not having any guns just means you're unarmed and I bought a gun off the black market now sit there while I rob your home and rape your wife. If you move I shoot your dick because I'm Europe's infamous Dick-Shooting Bandit!

Yeah, I thoght about the blackmarket too. If it works with drugs, it works with guns too. If someone wants to kill me, I am sure he could do it. But isn't that in your case true too? (maybe someone comes with some firends and fully prepared?)(the difference is that in an 'unarmed' country one is more easily discoverd, as one is doing a major-illegal and risky thing [buying a gun] in the preparations for the crime)
We all want to have the same thing: security and freedom. Allowing guns makes people more free but leads objectively to more deadly encounters (less security)?
freedom vs security

1568481715_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw.body:
> [zenanon](#comment_10_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEGimc9J): Possibly. I've never gotten that far behind. Can you make a backup (to make sure and keep your 'data' directory) and install it over an existing installation?

Just copy the 'data' folder.
(In your zero net folder there is folder named 'data' in it is all data you need. When you have started and closed your new version of zeronet in some other folder, you can just delete the data folder of new zeronet and copy the old 'data' folder into the directory.)

1567999355_1D6UcmziWg55aXV6TnCksXpjsFJ4g.body: I hold a spider in a corner in my room and feed it with annoying insects.

> [cactusdragon](#comment_10_1FXFTPnN5etVrX3KURv61vEEbEqayTjiLr): I hold a spider in a corner in my room and feed it with annoying insects.

Insects have like alomst all things a subjective value to them. In a sense we value them so low that we have no problem with killing them. 
Have you a problem with killing sigle celled eukaryotes or microorganisms by eating?

1568893908_1KkYDy7vnYwccFCDugksbCb4izK5H.body:
> [sperg](#comment_11_19WVEMLEDso1JfM3bnHXsjHVEQ1dr3VpvQ): Big if true. Tor/Tor Browser is open source. How would they hide a deliberate back door?

They could just not fix a security flaw found out by some secret service. But this is unprobable and wouldn't work on all without being exposed. Such security flaws a kept to deanonymise VERY important persons.
tor makes you not anonym but pseudonym. Your own actions make you anonym (like writing in very simple english).

> [sperg](#comment_12_19WVEMLEDso1JfM3bnHXsjHVEQ1dr3VpvQ): Ok, but you said "NEVER use it." I imagine some agencies have 0-day exploits for Tor but what is the alternative? What do you think is a better Tor setup to use?

there is no better alternative for the things tor does do and i like tor. But from the concept it would be probably better to have a system like i2p + zeronet (problem: it would be slow as hell to integrate in to the network like i2p)

> [sperg](#comment_12_19WVEMLEDso1JfM3bnHXsjHVEQ1dr3VpvQ): Ok, but you said "NEVER use it." I imagine some agencies have 0-day exploits for Tor but what is the alternative? What do you think is a better Tor setup to use?

I said it may be possible to track you, but unprobable. For example tor wasn't at fault when the man behind silkroad was captured (it was his own fault for promoting his website with his real name)

1567786547_1BumxHqxXBHScLoq1wAJqiFZXJ4c1.body:
If you use zeronet on tor mode and just started you are anonymous as you haven't exposed anything of you. With time and use come information snippets. You are pseudonyme. One might use this information to profile you. They still don't know who you are. A mistake and you could be exposed. To clarify all trafic goes over tor; as long as you don't do something that links you to the realworld you should be ok (this starts by your writing style). And even then nobody might care.

This is a very good read and even though about whonix, universal:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/DoNot

> [kidcourageous](#comment_258_1aaGBN84Cc8VE7iocUxPXiRVhx9qSfXw6): Always do your best to be anon, but always assume you are not.

you could always assume that your not anonymous, but it the same as saying that you aren't safe at home.
Feel safe and be done with. There is almost no reason to feel unsafe as your thread model isn't probably a state actor but some company, for whom it isn't possible or unprofitable trying to deanonyminise you.

1570340092_1HFbnmQ8wBoYBNqZy2wVfyLg19v4W.body:
https://tox.chat/ or just download it

"Does Tox leak my IP address?

Tox makes no attempt to cloak your IP address when communicating with other users, as the whole point of peer-to-peer is to connect you directly to your friends. A workaround does exist in the form of tunneling your Tox connections through Tor. However, a user cannot uncover another user's IP address using only a Tox ID to find the user in the DHT, the IP address will only be discernible when the users become “friends.” "
- https://wiki.tox.chat/users/faq#what_is_tox

1571344199_198XrgRCdJ2suDf2sg3aMJx69qpYT.body:
> [sunil123](#comment_2_198XrgRCdJ2suDf2sg3aMJx69qpYTzXDXZ): Yes, but this model of zeronet can actually serve more users [scalable] than blockchains?

You must imagine a blockchain this way:
Block1: you have data - Block2: you have a hash of Block1 and data - Block3: you have a hash of Block2 and data
If you want to change the data of block1 the hash of Block2 wouldn't correspond with the new hash of Block1. If you want to change the data without someone noticing, you would have to hash almost the entire blockchain from that point till the last block.  
It means there is no way on lengthy blockchains to change the content without being noticed. 
THEY ARE NO DARK WEB!!! :'( you spamer

1571675037_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_870_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): Harmony creates Intelligence, or rather both are the same thing

I think "harmony" isn't appropriate here, as it is more or less of religious or philosophic background.
Psychology is a science.
Shane Legg & Marcus Hutter  - A synthesis of 70+ definitions from psychology, philosophy, and AI researchers: 
"Intelligence measures an agent's ability to achieve goals in a wide range of environments",[5] which has been mathematically formalized.[16] Wikipedia
And on another note, evolution itself is a slow process and not rly experiencable by a single person in it's own species.
(correct me please)
Developement of technology on the other hand is caused by information and a much faster process through the telecomunication revolution. There is a saying that technology is outgrowing us. That is true, at least for the older generations. I think: This outgrowth was back then in ancient times more unpropable, as they had never these sort of revolutions (agriculture, industrial, digital)
-_-
